description: This is a route across sandbars in Lake Winnipeg from the mainland at Sandy Bay to Elk Island.  By following this route the water should not rise above the waist of an average height person.  Caution is advised in any type of storm condition.  There are trails on Elk Island and no motorized vehicles of any kind are permitted.
directions: PTH 59 to Provincial Road 504 to the end. Turn left on Olafson Blvd and travel to the end.  There is no parking available anywhere.  Another option is to take PTH 59 to the end, park in Victoria Beach parking lot and walk to Sandy Bay.  Download directions and GPS of the trail under Victoria Beach Manitoba on this site.
title: Elk Island
